newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Zinc price seen up 20 pct in 97 - Macquarie.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Zinc price seen up 20 pct in 97 - Macquarie.

text.p: Declining stockpiles are expected to underpin an average 20 percent rise in zinc prices this year, Macquarie Equities Ltd said in a report.
"The nightmare is nearly over for zinc producers as zinc prices are on the verge of a strong recovery," Macquarie said.
London Metal Exchange (LME) cash zinc is forecast to average US$1,235 a tonne (56 cents a pound) in 1997 versus US$1,027 (46.6 cents) in 1996, it said.
Cash zinc currently fetches about US$1,191 (54 cents).

Zinc stocks have fallen in each quarter since the third quarter of 1994, shaving a quarter-million tonnes from stock peak levels and are now nearing levels needed to justfy prices permanently above 50 cents a pound, Macquarie said in a report.
"Stocks probably need to fall by another 90,000 tonnes to allow this to happen, although fund and consumer buying could accelerate the recovery," Macquarie said.
The closely-watched stocks-to-consumption ratio stood at 7.8 weeks at the end of last year and are nearing the seven-week mark, at which time prices should start moving up, it said.
"This should take place during the second quarter of 1997," Macquarie said.
